items.title: New York City Comptroller Resists Investor’s Calls for Apple Buyback
items.abstract: Scott M. Stringer will urge investors to vote against a proposal for a stock buyback worth $50 billion, arguing that Apple’s management should make such decisions itself.

items.title: Family Trust Offers Possible Clues to How Spitzer Would Invest City’s Funds
items.abstract: Eliot Spitzer’s tenure as a trustee for the Bernard and Anne Spitzer Charitable Trust gives a small but intriguing window onto how he might manage a far larger pool of money.
keywords: Spitzer, Bernard and Anne, Charitable Trust

items.title: The Best Way to Rejuvenate Rural America? Invest in Cities
items.abstract: There is already clear evidence that the economic prosperity of urban areas benefits small towns.

items.title: High Design: The Revolution Taking Over Cannabis Dispensaries
items.abstract: As cannabis legalization has become more widespread, retailers are getting increasingly serious about the design and branding of their shops.

items.title: As China Reduces Local Spending, Cities Woo Private Investors
items.abstract: Hundreds of cities across China are turning to deep-pocketed private investors to help foot the bill for public infrastructure and services.
